Content:: During the COVID-19 pandemic in Croatia, vaccination against COVID-19 began on 27 December 2020.[2] The Croatian government ordered vaccines together with the EU. 8.7 million doses have been ordered.[3] As of 3 February 2022, over 2.2 million people were fully vaccinated,[4] corresponding to a 63% vaccination rate of the country's population.[5] This article about COVID-19 vaccines is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. This Croatia-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
